example.eg: He hit his brother in the stomach with his fist.
example.egtrans: 他朝他兄弟的腹部打了一拳。

example.eg: The driver suffered a head injury when his car hit a tree.
example.egtrans: 汽车撞到树上，司机头部受伤。

example.eg: Richard was driving to work when he hit a pedestrian.
example.egtrans: 理查德开车去上班时撞到了一位行人。//走神的司机越了线，撞上迎面开来的车辆。

example.eg: He was so tall that he had to make an effort not to hit his head when he walked through a door.
example.egtrans: 他个子很高，当他穿过一道门时，他必须努力不让自己的头撞到。

example.eg: The child fell over and hit his head on the wooden floor.
example.egtrans: 那个孩子跌了一跤，头撞到了木地板上。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把（某个身体部位）碰撞到…上

example.eg: The arrow hit the bullseye.
example.egtrans: 箭射中了靶心。

example.eg: The stock hit a record high today on the earnings news.
example.egtrans: 今天股票在盈利消息的刺激下创下历史新高。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 达到, 完成, 实现

example.eg: Of your five arrows, you got three hits.
example.egtrans: 你五箭中有三箭命中。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 命中, 击中, 射中

example.eg: The film was a hit with teenagers.
example.egtrans: 这部电影在青少年中大获成功。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 成功而风行一时的事物，成功而轰动一时的人物

example.eg: In golf, you only get one hit off the tee.
example.egtrans: 打高尔夫时，你只有一次发球机会。

example.eg: His new song is a massive hit.
example.egtrans: 他的新歌成为一首热门金曲。

example.eg: We have seen a lot of hits on the new website.
example.egtrans: 我们看到新网站的点击量已经很大了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 网页访问, 网页点击

example.eg: My first search did not return many hits.
The mafia boss ordered the hit on his former associate.
example.egtrans: 黑手党老大下令除掉他以前的手下。

example.eg: Another hit from the pipe satisfied the addict.
example.egtrans: 瘾君子又从烟斗里吸了一口掺有毒品的烟，心满意足了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 一剂麻醉毒品，一口掺有麻醉剂的烟

example.eg: I am sick of the constant hits I am getting because of what I said.
example.egtrans: 我的话给我招来了连续不断的抨击，让我厌烦不已。

example.eg: The player had three hits today, but no runs.
example.egtrans: 该球员今天三次安打，但没有得分。

example.eg: Despite his pleas, she just kept hitting.
example.egtrans: 尽管他开口求饶，但她还是打个不停。

example.eg: It never hit me that I could post the documents.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使突然想到, 使突然意识到

example.eg: The news of her father's death hit her hard.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使受痛苦, 伤害, 打击

example.eg: And he hits the basket to tie the game!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 投中得分, 射门得分

example.eg: After a bad day at work, he tends to hit the gin.
example.egtrans: 一天工作不愉快后，他常常喝杜松子酒。

example.eg: The town was hit by the storm on Tuesday.

dsense.name: hit [sth]
dsense.guideword: informal (bars, street, shops, etc.: go there) (酒吧、商店等)

example.eg: On Friday night I usually hit the bars with my friends.
Iran has warned it will hit back if it is attacked by the United States.
Parents have hit back, saying the accusations about their children are unfounded.
example.egtrans: 家长们对此予以回应，称对他们孩子的指责是没有根据的。

example.eg: The victim of the attempted mugging hit back at his attackers, and they ran off empty-handed.
The pop star has hit back at her critics with a series of tweets.

dsense.name: hit [sb] in
dsense.guideword: (baseball: win points from hit) (棒球术语)

example.eg: The batter hit in two runners.

dsense.name: hit off [sth/sb]
dsense.guideword: US (imitate in order to satirize) (为了讽刺)

dsense.name: hit on [sb]
dsense.guideword: mainly US, slang (flirt with, try to seduce) (俚语)

example.eg: Gladys told the guy who was hitting on her to get lost.
example.egtrans: 格拉迪斯让那个勾引她的男人滚开。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 勾引, 与...调情, 向...示爱

example.eg: I have hit upon a great way to save money: stay in bed all day!
example.egtrans: 我忽然想到一个省钱妙计，那就是整天都躺床上不动！

trans_examp.trans_cn: 忽然想到, 偶然想到, 偶然发现

example.eg: After Tony had teased him for more than an hour, Pete finally hit out at him.
The actress has hit out at critics, who she claims have misunderstood her performance.
The addicts in the alley were hitting up.
example.egtrans: 小巷里瘾君子在注射毒品。

example.eg: I'm looking for a room to rent; if anyone knows of anything, hit me up.
example.egtrans: 我要租一间房，如果任何人有相关消息，请联系我。

example.eg: Dave is always hitting his friends up when he's short on cash.
example.egtrans: 戴夫缺钱的时候总是去找他的朋友。

example.eg: The batter got a base hit and the runner scored easily.
Greg crossed the street without checking for traffic, and was consequently hit by a car.
Max's spaghetti Bolognese was a big hit with his girlfriend.
'Take Me Out' by Franz Ferdinand was one of the big hits of 2004.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 热门歌曲, 非常流行的歌曲

example.eg: The batter hit a double.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 受挫的, 被严重打击的

dsense.name: hit a brick wall, hit a wall

example.eg: If I hit a brick wall while writing, I find a thirty-minute run helps me to refocus.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 遇到障碍, 遭遇瓶颈

dsense.name: hit a nerve, touch a nerve, strike a nerve, hit a raw nerve, touch a raw nerve, strike a raw nerve
hit and miss, hit-and-miss, hit or miss, hit-or-miss

example.eg: The weather is very hit and miss for July - rain one day, sunshine the next.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 有时命中有时没有命中的, 不论成功与否, 胡乱地
采用不正当手段, 下暗手

example.eg: Even though he wasn't talking about me, the speaker's comments about being sympathetic to your children hit close to home.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 说到痛处, 感同身受

example.eg: The extent of Ruth's weight problem really hit home when she saw a picture of herself on a night out.
Me and my new roommate hit it off from the start.
example.egtrans: 我和我的新室友打一开始就相处融洽。

example.eg: Which song was at the top of the hit parade on this day in 1963?

dsense.name: hit rock bottom, hit bottom, reach rock bottom
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (reach lowest, worst level) (比喻义)

example.eg: Mike hit rock bottom when he failed all his exams.
Friends was a hit show on both sides of the Atlantic.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 大热的舞台剧, 热门剧

example.eg: My economics course is really difficult; I'm going to have to hit the books every day in order to understand it.

dsense.name: hit the bottle
dsense.guideword: slang, figurative (drink alcohol excessively) (俚语，比喻)

example.eg: After the death of his beloved wife, the young man began to hit the bottle every night.

dsense.name: hit the deck
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (drop to the ground to protect oneself) (比喻，非正式用语)

example.eg: At the first sound of a gunshot, everybody in the room hit the deck.

dsense.name: when the s*** hits the fan
dsense.guideword: slang, vulgar (disturbing facts: become public) (俚语，粗俗)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 暴露于众, 公之于众

example.eg: She hit the ground running when she started her new job.
This position requires someone experienced who can hit the ground running.
The Governor's career was finished when it hit the headlines that he had used state funds to hire a hooker.
She played the slot machines everyday, but had yet to hit the jackpot.
Such a beautiful hotel room for such a low price!  We've really hit the jackpot this time!

dsense.name: hit the nail on the head

example.eg: Russell's comment really hit the nail on the head.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 正确无比, 几位正确

dsense.name: hit the road
dsense.guideword: slang, figurative (leave, start a journey) (俚语，比喻)

example.eg: We rose early and hit the road before 7.00 am.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 上路，离开某地开始旅程

dsense.name: hit the roof, hit the ceiling

example.eg: When I told my boss what had happened, he hit the roof.

dsense.name: hit the sack, hit the hay
hit the skids
dsense.guideword: informal (decline in status or value) (比喻义)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 恰到好处, 正好满足

dsense.name: hit the wall
dsense.guideword: figurative (reach a mental or physical limit)

example.eg: The marathon runner's endurance hit the wall around the 20th mile.
Watch out for Ralph, he's always hitting people up for money.
example.egtrans: 小心拉尔夫，他总是向人讨钱。

example.eg: His divorce hit him where it hurts: in his wallet.  When he said I was ugly, he hit me where it hurts.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 击中某人痛处, 击中要害
大步前进, 稳健发展
自信前进, 胸有成竹地前进

example.eg: The collision would have been considered an accident, but after the driver sped off it became a hit-and-run.
A hit-and-run is a risky strategy that potentially has a high reward.
The police went to auto body repair shops to find the hit-and-run driver's car.
The politician was arrested for hiring a hitman to kill one of his rivals.

dsense.name: make the big time, hit the big time

example.eg: I moved to Hollywood, trying to make the big time.

dsense.name: no-hit
dsense.guideword: (baseball: one team did not hit ball) (棒球)

example.eg: When their song became a best-seller, the band thought they were going to be successful for life; however, they unfortunately ended up being a one hit wonder.

dsense.name: pinch hit
dsense.guideword: (baseball; hit made by pinch hitter) (棒球术语)

dsense.name: pinch-hit for [sb]
dsense.guideword: (baseball: substitute for [sb] at bat) (棒球术语)

example.eg: The rookie was put in the line-up to pinch-hit for the pitcher in the ninth inning.
Walk on the Wild Side was a smash hit for Lou Reed in 1972.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 很流行的东西，轰动的演出

example.eg: The crowd cheered when the batter hit a triple.
